meanings.definition: A person who interferes or meddles in the affairs of others.
meanings.sent1: The buttinsky always pokes their nose into everyone's business.
meanings.sent2: She became known as a buttinsky because she couldn't resist getting involved in other people's problems.
meanings.sent3: The buttinsky at the park tried to give unsolicited advice to everyone playing chess.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a buttinsky, constantly interrupting her conversations with friends.
meanings.sent5: The buttinsky's constant meddling made it hard for people to solve their own issues.

meanings.definition: To interfere or meddle in the affairs of others.
meanings.sent1: Please don't buttinsky in my personal matters.
meanings.sent2: He tends to buttinsky whenever he sees someone struggling, thinking he knows best.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to buttinsky in the middle of the dog's bath time, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to buttinsky with the plans for the outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't help but buttinsky, even though she knew it wasn't her place to interfere.
